# Draft:Edward E. Good

Edward E. Good (May 13, 1862 â€“ August 4, 1937) was a justice of the Nebraska Supreme Court from 1923 until his death in 1937.
"Born May 13, 1862, at Bloomington Iowa, Justice Good came to Nebraska in 1885 after graduating from the University of Iowa. In quick succession he was county attorney of Saunders county supreme court commissioner and district judge of the fifth judicial district".
In Schmidt vs. Saline county, Good "held that the net income from farm property should be a factor in determining the value of the farm property for taxation. In another famed case, Justice Good held invalid a law which would have limited drug stores to the sale of items listed in the U.S. Pharmacopeia."
(more in obit)
